Detailed Description

A Bitmap represents a writable bitmap resource. Every bitmap has a size, a color depth and bitmap data. Per default each bitmap has the same data format as the display, which allows a very fast drawing.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Bitmap::Bitmap (   ) 
 

Bitmap::Bitmap (  XYDIM  width,
XYDIM  height,
BOOLEAN  transparent = FALSE,
ColorValue  transparent_color = 0,
BOOLEAN  compressed = FALSE,
BOOLEAN  copyrighted = FALSE,
INT  display_idx = 0,
DDrvAtomPtr  external_buffer = 0,
BOOLEAN  free_external_buffer = FALSE,
BOOLEAN  create_alpha_mask = FALSE
) 
 

Parameters:
width Width in pixels.
height Height in pixels.
transparent Indicates, whether the bitmap contains transparent pixels.
transparent_color Color-value of the pixels, which should be transparent. The parameter transparent must be set to TRUE.
compressed Indicates, whether the data of the bitmap is compressed. Currently only RLE-compressed bitmaps are supported.
copyrighted Indicates, whether the bitmap is copyrighted.
display_idx Index of the display, where the bitmap should be drawn.
external_buffer Per default a buffer is allocated, which contains the pixel-data of the bitmap (this buffer is automatically freed in the destructor). An already pre-allocated external buffer can be assigned by providing a pointer to this buffer. The size of the needed buffer can be retrieved by invoking Bitmap::GetBufferByteCount(). Note that the external buffer is only freed if parameter free_external_buffer states so, otherwise the client has to destroy the external buffer.
Attention: In order to not change the interface too much (because external buffers will probably be deprecated in the medium term), when using an external buffer for the bitmap data it is necessary that the alphamask is also an external buffer. The external alphamask buffer must be set with the SetAlphaMask() method. I. e. if an external bitmap buffer is used, the allocation the allocation and destruction of the alpha mask has to be done outside. If an external buffer is used but no alpha mask is required nothing further has to be done.
Parameters:
free_external_buffer Indicates, whether the external buffer provided should be freed on destruction.
create_alpha_mask If set to TRUE, an alpha mask is created as soon as the first Bitmap::SetAlphaValue is invoked. The alpha mask is destructed automatically in the destructor.

BOOLEAN Bitmap::IsValid (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns:
TRUE, if the bitmap buffer is valid. Valid means that the bitmap buffer could be allocated or is already available. When creating a bitmap it should always be checked whether the bitmap buffer is valid.

void Bitmap::SetBits (  DDrvAtomPtr  bits,
BOOLEAN  free_external_buffer = FALSE
) 
 

Sets the pointer to the bits of the bitmap. The current memory pointed to is deleted if it either was automatically allocated or it was provided externally and stated that it should be deleted when required. If free_external_buffer is TRUE then the memory pointed to will be freed on destruction or before setting new bits.
